meanings.definition: Serving as an indication or sign.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were an indicational sign of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: Her raised eyebrow was an indicational response to his strange comment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring was an indicational signal that it was content.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room was an indicational warning of trouble ahead.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's smile was an indicational clue that the students had done well.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to an indication.
meanings.sent1: The indicational message on the screen directed us to the correct room.
meanings.sent2: She followed the indicational signs that led her to the museum entrance.
meanings.sent3: The indicational map helped them navigate through the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent4: The indicational symbol on the package indicated its contents.
meanings.sent5: The indicational label on the bottle warned of its contents.
